```diff
  ### Function to get current mode
  
- ```bash
- function get_interaction_mode() {
-   local mode_file="memory-bank/system/interaction-mode.txt"
-   if [ -f "$mode_file" ]; then
-     cat "$mode_file"
-   else
-     # Default to MANUAL for safety
-     echo "MANUAL"
-   fi
+ ```
+ // Pseudocode for the AI assistant.
+ // Retrieve current interaction mode.
+ function GET_CURRENT_INTERACTION_MODE_FROM_SYSTEM() {
+   const mode_file_path = "memory-bank/system/interaction-mode.txt"
+   if (CHECK_FILE_EXISTS(mode_file_path)) {
+     return READ_FILE_CONTENT(mode_file_path).trim()
+   } else {
+     // Default to MANUAL for safety if file not found
+     return "MANUAL"
+   }
  }
  ```
  
  ### Example usage in another rule
  
- ```bash
- # Pseudocode for the AI assistant in PLAN mode
- 
- # ... start of planning logic ...
- 
- local interaction_mode=$(get_interaction_mode)
- 
- if [ "$interaction_mode" = "MANUAL" ]; then
-   # Ask clarifying questions to the user
-   echo "I have several implementation options. Which do you prefer?"
-   # ... logic for interactive planning ...
- else # AUTO
-   # Make decision autonomously
-   echo "Optimal implementation option selected based on best practices."
-   # ... logic for automatic planning ...
- fi
  ```
```

---

Read file: _cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/planning/isolated-design.mdc.md

---



---

–Ø –ø—Ä–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞–ª —Ñ–∞–π–ª `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/planning/isolated-design.mdc.md`. –û–Ω —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏—Ç –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –±–ª–æ–∫–æ–≤ –∫–æ–¥–∞ TypeScript, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –∞–±—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–≥–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤ –ø—Å–µ–≤–¥–æ–∫–æ–¥. –Ø –Ω–∞—á–Ω—É —Å —Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥–∞ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ "Interface Design", –∑–∞–º–µ–Ω–∏–≤ TypeScript –Ω–∞ –ø—Å–µ–≤–¥–æ–∫–æ–¥.

---

```diff
  
  ### Interface Design:
- ```typescript
+ ```
  // Good: Clear, focused interface
- interface UserRepository {
-   findById(id: string): Promise<User | null>;
-   save(user: User): Promise<void>;
-   delete(id: string): Promise<void>;
- }
+ INTERFACE UserRepository
+   FUNCTION findById(id: STRING): PROMISE<User OR NULL>
+   FUNCTION save(user: User): PROMISE<VOID>
+   FUNCTION delete(id: STRING): PROMISE<VOID>
+ END INTERFACE
  
  // Bad: Mixed responsibilities
- interface UserService {
-   findUser(id: string): Promise<User>;
-   saveUser(user: User): Promise<void>;
-   sendEmail(user: User): Promise<void>; // Different responsibility
-   generateReport(): Promise<Report>;    // Different responsibility
- }
+ INTERFACE UserService
+   FUNCTION findUser(id: STRING): PROMISE<User>
+   FUNCTION saveUser(user: User): PROMISE<VOID>
+   FUNCTION sendEmail(user: User): PROMISE<VOID> // Different responsibility
+   FUNCTION generateReport(): PROMISE<Report>    // Different responsibility
+ END INTERFACE
  ```
  
```

---

–Ø –ø—Ä–µ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞–ª –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—ã TypeScript –≤ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ "Interface Design" –≤ –ø—Å–µ–≤–¥–æ–∫–æ–¥. –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å —è –æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—é —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª "Dependency Management", –∑–∞–º–µ–Ω–∏–≤ TypeScript –Ω–∞ –ø—Å–µ–≤–¥–æ–∫–æ–¥.

---

```diff
  
  ### Dependency Management:
- ```typescript
+ ```
  // Good: Dependency injection
- class UserService {
-   constructor(
-     private userRepo: UserRepository,
-     private emailService: EmailService
-   ) {}
- }
+ CLASS UserService
+   CONSTRUCTOR(userRepo: UserRepository, emailService: EmailService)
+     SET THIS.userRepo = userRepo
+     SET THIS.emailService = emailService
+   END CONSTRUCTOR
+ END CLASS
  
  // Bad: Direct dependencies
- class UserService {
-   private userRepo = new DatabaseUserRepository(); // Hard dependency
-   private emailService = new SMTPEmailService();   // Hard dependency
- }
+ CLASS UserService
+   DECLARE userRepo = NEW DatabaseUserRepository()
+   DECLARE emailService = NEW SMTPEmailService()
+ END CLASS
  ```
  
```

---



---

–Ø –ø—Ä–µ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞–ª –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—ã TypeScript –≤ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ "–£–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—è–º–∏" –≤ –ø—Å–µ–≤–¥–æ–∫–æ–¥. –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å —è –æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—é —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª "–ò–∑–æ–ª—è—Ü–∏—è –º–æ–¥—É–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤", –∑–∞–º–µ–Ω–∏–≤ TypeScript –ø—Å–µ–≤–¥–æ–∫–æ–¥–æ–º.

---

```diff
  
  ### Unit Test Isolation:
- ```typescript
+ ```
  // Good: Isolated unit test
- describe('UserService', () => {
-   let userService: UserService;

- ```javascript

  // Example invariant validation

+   CALL VALIDATION.ASSERT(condition: activeTask IS NOT NULL, message: "Active task must exist")

- // Old way of doing things

+ // PSEUDOCODE: Old way of doing things
  ```

- ```javascript
- // New way of doing things
+ ```
+ // PSEUDOCODE: New way of doing things
  ```

–Ø –ø—Ä–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞–ª —Ñ–∞–π–ª `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/git-workflow/branch-management.mdc.md`. –û–Ω —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏—Ç –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –±–ª–æ–∫–æ–≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥ `bash`, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –ø—Ä–µ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤ –ø—Å–µ–≤–¥–æ–∫–æ–¥. –Ø –Ω–∞—á–Ω—É —Å —Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥–∞ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ "Pre-Task Backup Creation".

---

```diff
  
  ### 1. Pre-Task Backup Creation:
- ```bash
- # Create backup branch from current main
- git checkout main
- git pull origin main
- git checkout -b backup/pre-[task-id]-$(date +%Y%m%d)
- git push origin backup/pre-[task-id]-$(date +%Y%m%d)
+ ```
+ // Create backup branch from current main
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PULL(remote: "origin", branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT_NEW_BRANCH(branch: "backup/pre-[task-id]-{PSEUDOCODE:GET_CURRENT_DATE("YYYYMMDD")}")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PUSH(remote: "origin", branch: "backup/pre-[task-id]-{PSEUDOCODE:GET_CURRENT_DATE("YYYYMMDD")}")
  ```
  
```

---



---

–Ø –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤—ë–ª –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã Bash –¥–ª—è —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è —Ä–µ–∑–µ—Ä–≤–Ω–æ–π –∫–æ–ø–∏–∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–µ–π –≤ –ø—Å–µ–≤–¥–æ–∫–æ–¥. –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –∑–∞–π–º—É—Å—å –∞–Ω–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–Ω–æ–π –∞–±—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∫—Ü–∏–µ–π –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ "–°–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤–µ—Ç–∫–∏ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏".

–Ø –ø—ã—Ç–∞–ª—Å—è –æ–±–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—å —Ñ–∞–π–ª, –Ω–æ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–∏–ª–∏—Å—å. –≠—Ç–æ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –Ω–µ—Å–æ–≤–ø–∞–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ –∫–æ–¥–µ. –°–µ–π—á–∞—Å —è —Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞—é —Ñ–∞–π–ª, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã —É–±–µ–¥–∏—Ç—å—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ —É –º–µ–Ω—è —Å–∞–º–∞—è –∞–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—è, –∏ –ø–æ–ø—Ä–æ–±—É—é –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—å –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –µ—â—ë —Ä–∞–∑.

```diff
  
  ### 2. Feature Branch Creation:
- ```bash
- # Create feature branch from main
- git checkout main
- git checkout -b feature/[task-id]-[description]
- git push -u origin feature/[task-id]-[description]
+ ```
+ // Create feature branch from main
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT_NEW_BRANCH(branch: "feature/[task-id]-[description]")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PUSH_SET_UPSTREAM(remote: "origin", branch: "feature/[task-id]-[description]")
  ```
  
```

---

–Ø —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª —Å–µ–∫—Ü–∏—é "–°–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤–µ—Ç–∫–∏ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏". –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å —è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π–¥—É –∫ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é —Å–µ–∫—Ü–∏–∏ "–°–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤–µ—Ç–∫–∏ —ç—Ç–∞–ø–∞ (–¥–ª—è —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–∞–¥–∞—á)" –≤ —Ç–æ–º –∂–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/git-workflow/branch-management.mdc.md`.

---

```diff
  
  ### 3. Phase Branch Creation (for complex tasks):
- ```bash
- # Create phase branch from feature branch
- git checkout feature/[task-id]-[description]
- git checkout -b phase/[task-id]-[phase-name]
- git push -u origin phase/[task-id]-[phase-name]
+ ```
+ // Create phase branch from feature branch
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "feature/[task-id]-[description]")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT_NEW_BRANCH(branch: "phase/[task-id]-[phase-name]")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PUSH_SET_UPSTREAM(remote: "origin", branch: "phase/[task-id]-[phase-name]")
  ```
  
```

---



---

–Ø —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª —Å–µ–∫—Ü–∏—é "–°–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤–µ—Ç–∫–∏ —ç—Ç–∞–ø–∞". –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å —è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π–¥—É –∫ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é —Å–µ–∫—Ü–∏–∏ "–û–±—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω–æ–µ —Å–ª–∏—è–Ω–∏–µ —ç—Ç–∞–ø–∞" –≤ —Ç–æ–º –∂–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/git-workflow/branch-management.mdc.md`.

---

```diff
  
  ### 4. Phase Merge Back:
- ```bash
- # Merge phase back to feature
- git checkout feature/[task-id]-[description]
- git merge phase/[task-id]-[phase-name]
- git push origin feature/[task-id]-[description]
- git branch -d phase/[task-id]-[phase-name]
+ ```
+ // Merge phase back to feature
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "feature/[task-id]-[description]")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_MERGE(branch: "phase/[task-id]-[phase-name]")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PUSH(remote: "origin", branch: "feature/[task-id]-[description]")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_BRANCH_DELETE(branch: "phase/[task-id]-[phase-name]")
  ```
  
```

---

–Ø —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ –æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–ª —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª "–û–±—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω–æ–µ —Å–ª–∏—è–Ω–∏–µ —ç—Ç–∞–ø–∞". –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å —è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π–¥—É –∫ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª—É "–ó–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏" –≤ —Ç–æ–º –∂–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/git-workflow/branch-management.mdc.md`.

---

```diff
  
  ### 5. Feature Completion:
- ```bash
- # Merge feature to main
- git checkout main
- git pull origin main
- git merge feature/[task-id]-[description]
- git push origin main
- git branch -d feature/[task-id]-[description]
+ ```
+ // Merge feature to main
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PULL(remote: "origin", branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_MERGE(branch: "feature/[task-id]-[description]")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PUSH(remote: "origin", branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_BRANCH_DELETE(branch: "feature/[task-id]-[description]")
  ```
  
```

---

–Ø —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª —Å–µ–∫—Ü–∏—é "–ó–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏". –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π–¥—É –∫ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é —Å–µ–∫—Ü–∏–∏ "–†–∞–±–æ—á–∏–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å —ç–∫—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è" –≤ —Ç–æ–º –∂–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/git-workflow/branch-management.mdc.md`.

---

```diff
  
  ### Hotfix Workflow:
- ```bash
- # Create hotfix from main
- git checkout main
- git pull origin main
- git checkout -b hotfix/[issue-description]
- 
- # Make fix and test
- # ... fix code ...
+ ```
+ // Create hotfix from main
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PULL(remote: "origin", branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT_NEW_BRANCH(branch: "hotfix/[issue-description]")
+ 
+ // Make fix and test
+ // ... fix code ...
  
- # Merge back to main
- git checkout main
- git merge hotfix/[issue-description]
- git push origin main
- 
- # Also merge to current feature branches if needed
- git checkout feature/[current-task]
- git merge main
+ // Merge back to main
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_MERGE(branch: "hotfix/[issue-description]")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PUSH(remote: "origin", branch: "main")
+ 
+ // Also merge to current feature branches if needed
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "feature/[current-task]")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_MERGE(branch: "main")
  ```
  
```

---



---

–Ø —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ –æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–ª —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª "Hotfix Workflow". –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π–¥—É –∫ —Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥—É —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ "Rollback Procedure" –≤ —Ç–æ–º –∂–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/git-workflow/branch-management.mdc.md`.

---

```diff
  
  ### Rollback Procedure:
- ```bash
- # If feature branch has issues, rollback to backup
- git checkout main
- git reset --hard backup/pre-[task-id]-[date]
- git push --force-with-lease origin main
- 
- # Or rollback specific commits
- git revert [commit-hash]
+ ```
+ // If feature branch has issues, rollback to backup
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_RESET_HARD(branch: "backup/pre-[task-id]-[date]")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PUSH_FORCE_WITH_LEASE(remote: "origin", branch: "main")
+ 
+ // Or rollback specific commits
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_REVERT(commit_hash: "[commit-hash]")
  ```
  
```

–Ø —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ –æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª "–ü—Ä–æ—Ü–µ–¥—É—Ä–∞ –æ—Ç–∫–∞—Ç–∞". –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π–¥—É –∫ —Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥—É —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ "–†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–π –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã" –≤ —Ç–æ–º –∂–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/git-workflow/branch-management.mdc.md`.

```diff
  
  ### Team Feature Development:
- ```bash
- # Shared feature branch
- feature/[task-id]-[description]
+ ```
+ // Shared feature branch
+ BRANCH_NAME: feature/[task-id]-[description]
  
- # Individual developer branches
- feature/[task-id]-[description]-[developer-name]
+ // Individual developer branches
+ BRANCH_NAME: feature/[task-id]-[description]-[developer-name]
  ```
  
```

  ### Git Hooks:
- - Pre-commit: Run tests and linting
- - Pre-push: Ensure branch is up to date
- - Post-merge: Clean up temporary files

+ - Post-merge: CALL PSEUDOCODE:CLEAN_UP_TEMPORARY_FILES()
  
  ### CI/CD Integration:

–Ø –ø—Ä–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–ª —Ñ–∞–π–ª `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/git-workflow/backup-verification.mdc.md`. –í –Ω—ë–º –µ—Å—Ç—å –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –±–ª–æ–∫–æ–≤ –∫–æ–¥–∞ –Ω–∞ Bash, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∞—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –ø—Å–µ–≤–¥–æ–∫–æ–¥. –ù–∞—á–Ω—É —Å —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ "–®–∞–≥ 1: –ü—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∞ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—É—Å–∞ Git".

```diff
  
  ### Step 1: Git Status Verification
- ```bash
- # Check current git status
- git status
- 
- # Expected: Clean working tree or known changes
- # If unexpected changes exist, investigate before proceeding
+ ```
+ // Check current git status
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_STATUS()
+ 
+ // Expected: Clean working tree or known changes
+ // If unexpected changes exist, investigate before proceeding
  ```
  
```

---



---

–Ø —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª ¬´–®–∞–≥ 1: –ü—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∞ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—É—Å–∞ Git¬ª. –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π–¥—É –∫ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ ¬´–®–∞–≥ 2: –û—á–∏—Å—Ç–∫–∞ —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–µ–≥–æ –¥–µ—Ä–µ–≤–∞¬ª –≤ —Ç–æ–º –∂–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/git-workflow/backup-verification.mdc.md`.

---

```diff
  ```
  
- ### Step 2: Working Tree Cleanup
- ```bash
- # If working tree is dirty, stash changes
- git stash push -m "Pre-backup stash: $(date)"
- 
- # Verify working tree is now clean
- git status
- # Expected: "nothing to commit, working tree clean"
+ ### Step 2: Working Tree Cleanup:
+ ```
+ // If working tree is dirty, stash changes
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_STASH_PUSH(message: "Pre-backup stash: {PSEUDOCODE:GET_CURRENT_DATE()}")
+ 
+ // Verify working tree is now clean
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_STATUS()
+ // Expected: "nothing to commit, working tree clean"
  ```
  
```

- ### Step 3: Backup Branch Creation
- ```bash
- # Ensure we're on main branch
- git checkout main
- git pull origin main
- 
- # Create backup branch with timestamp
- BACKUP_NAME="backup/pre-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M)-$(git rev-parse --short HEAD)"
- git checkout -b "$BACKUP_NAME"
- git push origin "$BACKUP_NAME"
- 
- # Return to main
- git checkout main
+ ### Step 3: Backup Branch Creation:
+ ```
+ // Ensure we're on main branch
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PULL(remote: "origin", branch: "main")
+ 
+ // Create backup branch with timestamp
+ DECLARE BACKUP_NAME = "backup/pre-{PSEUDOCODE:GET_CURRENT_DATE("YYYYMMDD-HHMM")}-{CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_REV_PARSE_SHORT_HEAD()}"
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT_NEW_BRANCH(branch: BACKUP_NAME)
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PUSH(remote: "origin", branch: BACKUP_NAME)
+ 
+ // Return to main
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "main")
  ```

- ### Step 4: Backup Verification
- ```bash
- # Verify backup branch exists locally
- git branch | grep "backup/pre-$(date +%Y%m%d)"
- 
- # Verify backup branch exists remotely
- git ls-remote origin | grep "backup/pre-$(date +%Y%m%d)"
- 
- # Verify backup branch content matches main
- git diff main "$BACKUP_NAME"
- # Expected: No differences
+ ### Step 4: Backup Verification:
+ ```
+ // Verify backup branch exists locally
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_BRANCH_CONTAINS(pattern: "backup/pre-{PSEUDOCODE:GET_CURRENT_DATE("YYYYMMDD")}")
+ 
+ // Verify backup branch exists remotely
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_LS_REMOTE_CONTAINS(remote: "origin", pattern: "backup/pre-{PSEUDOCODE:GET_CURRENT_DATE("YYYYMMDD")}")
+ 
+ // Verify backup branch content matches main
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_DIFF(branch1: "main", branch2: "{BACKUP_NAME}")
+ // Expected: No differences
  ```
  
```

```diff
  
  ### Daily Verification Script:
- ```bash
- #!/bin/bash
- # daily-backup-check.sh
+ ```
+ // daily-backup-check.sh
  
- echo "=== Daily Backup Integrity Check ==="
- echo "Date: $(date)"
- 
- # Check for recent backup branches
- echo "Recent backup branches:"
- git branch -r | grep "backup/" | tail -5
- 
- # Verify backup branches are accessible
- for branch in $(git branch -r | grep "backup/" | tail -3); do
-     echo "Checking $branch..."
-     git show "$branch" --stat > /dev/null
-     if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
-         echo "‚úÖ $branch is accessible"
-     else
-         echo "‚ùå $branch is NOT accessible"
-     fi
- done
- 
- # Check backup tags
- echo "Recent backup tags:"
- git tag | grep "backup-" | tail -5
- 
- # Verify disk space for git objects
- echo "Git repository size:"
- du -sh .git/
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "=== Daily Backup Integrity Check ===")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Date: {PSEUDOCODE:GET_CURRENT_DATE()}")
+ 
+ // Check for recent backup branches
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Recent backup branches:")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_BRANCH_REMOTE_LIST_FILTERED(pattern: "backup/", count: 5)
+ 
+ // Verify backup branches are accessible
+ FOR EACH branch IN CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_BRANCH_REMOTE_LIST_FILTERED(pattern: "backup/", count: 3) DO
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Checking {branch}...")
+     IF CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_SHOW_STAT(branch: branch) IS SUCCESS THEN
+         CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "‚úÖ {branch} is accessible")
+     ELSE
+         CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "‚ùå {branch} is NOT accessible")
+     END IF
+ END FOR
+ 
+ // Check backup tags
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Recent backup tags:")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_TAG_LIST_FILTERED(pattern: "backup-", count: 5)
+ 
+ // Verify disk space for git objects
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Git repository size:")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GET_DIRECTORY_SIZE(path: ".git/")
  ```
  
```

–Ø —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–∞–ª —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª "–ï–∂–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≤–Ω—ã–π —Å–∫—Ä–∏–ø—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∏". –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π–¥—É –∫ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª—É "–ï–∂–µ–Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –≥–ª—É–±–æ–∫–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∞" –≤ —Ç–æ–º –∂–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/git-workflow/backup-verification.mdc.md`.

```diff
  
  ### Weekly Deep Verification:
- ```bash
- #!/bin/bash
- # weekly-backup-verification.sh
+ ```
+ // weekly-backup-verification.sh
  
- echo "=== Weekly Deep Backup Verification ==="
- 
- # Verify all backup branches
- for branch in $(git branch -r | grep "backup/"); do
-     echo "Deep checking $branch..."
- 
-     # Check branch integrity
-     git fsck --connectivity-only "$branch"
- 
-     # Verify branch can be checked out
-     git checkout "$branch" --quiet
-     if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
-         echo "‚úÖ $branch checkout successful"
-         git checkout main --quiet
-     else
-         echo "‚ùå $branch checkout failed"
-     fi
- done
- 
- # Clean up old backup branches (older than 30 days)
- echo "Cleaning up old backup branches..."
- git for-each-ref --format='%(refname:short) %(committerdate)' refs/remotes/origin/backup/ | \
- while read branch date; do
-     if [[ $(date -d "$date" +%s) -lt $(date -d "30 days ago" +%s) ]]; then
-         echo "Archiving old backup: $branch"
-         # Archive instead of delete for safety
-         git tag "archived-$(basename $branch)" "$branch"
-         git push origin "archived-$(basename $branch)"
-     fi
- done
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "=== Weekly Deep Backup Verification ===")
+ 
+ // Verify all backup branches
+ FOR EACH branch IN CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_BRANCH_REMOTE_LIST_FILTERED(pattern: "backup/") DO
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Deep checking {branch}...")
+ 
+     // Check branch integrity
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_FSCK_CONNECTIVITY_ONLY(branch: branch)
+ 
+     // Verify branch can be checked out
+     IF CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT_QUIET(branch: branch) IS SUCCESS THEN
+         CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "‚úÖ {branch} checkout successful")
+         CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT_QUIET(branch: "main")
+     ELSE
+         CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "‚ùå {branch} checkout failed")
+     END IF
+ END FOR
+ 
+ // Clean up old backup branches (older than 30 days)
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Cleaning up old backup branches...")
+ FOR EACH ref_data IN CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_FOR_EACH_REF(format: '%(refname:short) %(committerdate)', pattern: 'refs/remotes/origin/backup/') DO
+     DECLARE branch = PSEUDOCODE:EXTRACT_FIELD(data: ref_data, field_index: 0)
+     DECLARE date = PSEUDOCODE:EXTRACT_FIELD(data: ref_data, field_index: 1)
+     IF PSEUDOCODE:DATE_IS_OLDER_THAN(date: date, days: 30) THEN
+         CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Archiving old backup: {branch}")
+         // Archive instead of delete for safety
+         CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_TAG(tag_name: "archived-{CALL PSEUDOCODE:GET_BASENAME(branch: branch)}", branch: branch)
+         CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PUSH(remote: "origin", tag: "archived-{CALL PSEUDOCODE:GET_BASENAME(branch: branch)}")
+     END IF
+ END FOR
  ```
  
```

```diff
  
  ### Emergency Rollback to Backup:
- ```bash
- #!/bin/bash
- # emergency-rollback.sh
+ ```
+ // emergency-rollback.sh
  
- BACKUP_BRANCH="$1"
- if [ -z "$BACKUP_BRANCH" ]; then
-     echo "Usage: emergency-rollback.sh <backup-branch-name>"
-     echo "Available backups:"
-     git branch -r | grep "backup/"
-     exit 1
- fi
- 
- echo "=== EMERGENCY ROLLBACK PROCEDURE ==="
- echo "Rolling back to: $BACKUP_BRANCH"
- echo "Current HEAD: $(git rev-parse HEAD)"
- 
- # Confirm rollback
- read -p "Are you sure you want to rollback? (yes/no): " confirm
- if [ "$confirm" != "yes" ]; then
-     echo "Rollback cancelled"
-     exit 1
- fi
- 
- # Create emergency backup of current state
- EMERGENCY_BACKUP="emergency-backup-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S)"
- git checkout -b "$EMERGENCY_BACKUP"
- git push origin "$EMERGENCY_BACKUP"
- echo "Current state backed up to: $EMERGENCY_BACKUP"
- 
- # Perform rollback
- git checkout main
- git reset --hard "origin/$BACKUP_BRANCH"
- git push --force-with-lease origin main
- 
- echo "‚úÖ Rollback completed"
- echo "Emergency backup available at: $EMERGENCY_BACKUP"
+ DECLARE BACKUP_BRANCH = PARAMETER(index: 1)
+ IF BACKUP_BRANCH IS EMPTY THEN
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Usage: emergency-rollback.sh <backup-branch-name>")
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Available backups:")
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_BRANCH_REMOTE_LIST_FILTERED(pattern: "backup/")
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:EXIT_SYSTEM(code: 1)
+ END IF
+ 
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "=== EMERGENCY ROLLBACK PROCEDURE ===")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Rolling back to: {BACKUP_BRANCH}")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Current HEAD: {CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_REV_PARSE_HEAD()}")
+ 
+ // Confirm rollback
+ DECLARE confirm = CALL PSEUDOCODE:GET_USER_CONFIRMATION(prompt: "Are you sure you want to rollback? (yes/no): ")
+ IF confirm IS NOT "yes" THEN
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Rollback cancelled")
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:EXIT_SYSTEM(code: 1)
+ END IF
+ 
+ // Create emergency backup of current state
+ DECLARE EMERGENCY_BACKUP = "emergency-backup-{PSEUDOCODE:GET_CURRENT_DATE("YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS")}"
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT_NEW_BRANCH(branch: EMERGENCY_BACKUP)
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PUSH(remote: "origin", branch: EMERGENCY_BACKUP)
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Current state backed up to: {EMERGENCY_BACKUP}")
+ 
+ // Perform rollback
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_CHECKOUT(branch: "main")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_RESET_HARD(branch: "origin/{BACKUP_BRANCH}")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_PUSH_FORCE_WITH_LEASE(remote: "origin", branch: "main")
+ 
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "‚úÖ Rollback completed")
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Emergency backup available at: {EMERGENCY_BACKUP}")
  ```
  
```

```diff
  
  ### Selective File Recovery:
- ```bash
- #!/bin/bash
- # recover-file.sh
- 
- BACKUP_BRANCH="$1"
- FILE_PATH="$2"
- 
- if [ -z "$BACKUP_BRANCH" ] || [ -z "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
-     echo "Usage: recover-file.sh <backup-branch> <file-path>"
-     exit 1
- fi
- 
- echo "Recovering $FILE_PATH from $BACKUP_BRANCH"
- 
- # Verify file exists in backup
- git show "$BACKUP_BRANCH:$FILE_PATH" > /dev/null 2>&1
- if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
-     echo "‚ùå File not found in backup branch"
-     exit 1
- fi
- 
- # Create backup of current file
- if [ -f "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
-     cp "$FILE_PATH" "$FILE_PATH.backup-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S)"
-     echo "Current file backed up"
- fi
- 
- # Recover file from backup
- git show "$BACKUP_BRANCH:$FILE_PATH" > "$FILE_PATH"
- echo "‚úÖ File recovered from backup"
+ ```
+ // recover-file.sh
+ 
+ DECLARE BACKUP_BRANCH = PARAMETER(index: 1)
+ DECLARE FILE_PATH = PARAMETER(index: 2)
+ 
+ IF BACKUP_BRANCH IS EMPTY OR FILE_PATH IS EMPTY THEN
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Usage: recover-file.sh <backup-branch> <file-path>")
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:EXIT_SYSTEM(code: 1)
+ END IF
+ 
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Recovering {FILE_PATH} from {BACKUP_BRANCH}")
+ 
+ // Verify file exists in backup
+ IF CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_SHOW_PATH_EXISTS(branch: BACKUP_BRANCH, file_path: FILE_PATH) IS NOT SUCCESS THEN
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "‚ùå File not found in backup branch")
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:EXIT_SYSTEM(code: 1)
+ END IF
+ 
+ // Create backup of current file
+ IF CALL PSEUDOCODE:FILE_EXISTS(file_path: FILE_PATH) THEN
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:FILE_COPY(source: FILE_PATH, destination: "{FILE_PATH}.backup-{PSEUDOCODE:GET_CURRENT_DATE("YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS")}")
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Current file backed up")
+ END IF
+ 
+ // Recover file from backup
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:GIT_SHOW_TO_FILE(branch: BACKUP_BRANCH, file_path: FILE_PATH, output_file: FILE_PATH)
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "‚úÖ File recovered from backup")
  ```
  
```

  **Independent Mode Design**
- ```typescript
+ ```
  // Each mode is completely self-contained
- interface MemoryBankMode {
-   name: string;
-   initialize(): Promise<void>;
-   execute(): Promise<ModeResult>;
-   cleanup(): Promise<void>;
-   getRequiredDependencies(): string[];
-   getProvidedServices(): string[];
- }
- 
- class VANMode implements MemoryBankMode {
-   name = 'VAN';
+ INTERFACE MemoryBankMode
+   PROPERTY name: STRING
+   FUNCTION initialize(): PROMISE<VOID>
+   FUNCTION execute(): PROMISE<ModeResult>
+   FUNCTION cleanup(): PROMISE<VOID>
+   FUNCTION getRequiredDependencies(): ARRAY<STRING>
+   FUNCTION getProvidedServices(): ARRAY<STRING>
+ END INTERFACE
+ 
+ CLASS VANMode IMPLEMENTS MemoryBankMode
+   PROPERTY name = 'VAN'
  
    // Self-contained initialization
-   async initialize(): Promise<void> {
-     await this.loadConfiguration();
-     await this.validateSystemRequirements();
-     await this.setupWorkingDirectory();
-   }
+   ASYNC FUNCTION initialize(): PROMISE<VOID>
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.loadConfiguration()
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.validateSystemRequirements()
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.setupWorkingDirectory()
+   END FUNCTION
  
    // Independent execution
-   async execute(): Promise<ModeResult> {
-     const analysis = await this.analyzeRequirements();
-     const complexity = await this.determineComplexity();
-     const plan = await this.createInitialPlan();
+   ASYNC FUNCTION execute(): PROMISE<ModeResult>
+     DECLARE analysis = AWAIT CALL THIS.analyzeRequirements()
+     DECLARE complexity = AWAIT CALL THIS.determineComplexity()
+     DECLARE plan = AWAIT CALL THIS.createInitialPlan()
  
-     return {
+     RETURN {
        analysis,
        complexity,
        plan,
-       nextMode: this.determineNextMode(complexity)
-     };
-   }
+       nextMode: CALL THIS.determineNextMode(complexity)
+     }
+   END FUNCTION
  
    // Clean separation of dependencies
-   getRequiredDependencies(): string[] {
-     return ['file-system', 'configuration', 'task-parser'];
-   }
+   FUNCTION getRequiredDependencies(): ARRAY<STRING>
+     RETURN ['file-system', 'configuration', 'task-parser']
+   END FUNCTION
  
-   getProvidedServices(): string[] {
-     return ['requirement-analysis', 'complexity-assessment', 'initial-planning'];
-   }
- }
+   FUNCTION getProvidedServices(): ARRAY<STRING>

  // Standardized communication between modes
- interface ModeTransition {
-   fromMode: string;
-   toMode: string;
-   context: ModeContext;
-   validation: TransitionValidation;
- }
- 
- interface ModeContext {
-   tasks: Task[];
-   configuration: SystemConfiguration;
-   workingDirectory: string;
-   metadata: Record<string, any>;
- }
- 
- class ModeTransitionManager {
-   async transitionBetweenModes(
+ INTERFACE ModeTransition
+   PROPERTY fromMode: STRING
+   PROPERTY toMode: STRING
+   PROPERTY context: ModeContext
+   PROPERTY validation: TransitionValidation
+ END INTERFACE
+ 
+ INTERFACE ModeContext
+   PROPERTY tasks: ARRAY<Task>
+   PROPERTY configuration: SystemConfiguration
+   PROPERTY workingDirectory: STRING
+   PROPERTY metadata: MAP<STRING, ANY>
+ END INTERFACE
+ 
+ CLASS ModeTransitionManager
+   ASYNC FUNCTION transitionBetweenModes(
      from: MemoryBankMode,
      to: MemoryBankMode,
      context: ModeContext
-   ): Promise<TransitionResult> {
+   ): PROMISE<TransitionResult>
      // Validate transition is allowed
-     await this.validateTransition(from, to);
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.validateTransition(from, to)
  
      // Clean up source mode
-     await from.cleanup();
+     AWAIT CALL from.cleanup()
  
      // Transfer context
-     const transferredContext = await this.transferContext(context, from, to);
+     DECLARE transferredContext = AWAIT CALL THIS.transferContext(context, from, to)
  
      // Initialize target mode
-     await to.initialize();
+     AWAIT CALL to.initialize()
  
-     return {
-       success: true,
+     RETURN {
+       success: TRUE,
        context: transferredContext,
-       timestamp: new Date()
-     };
+       timestamp: CALL PSEUDOCODE:GET_CURRENT_DATE_TIME()
      }
- }
+   END FUNCTION

  **Service Layer Design**
- ```typescript
+ ```
  // Each service is independently testable and deployable
- abstract class IsolatedService {
-   abstract name: string;
-   abstract version: string;
- 
-   abstract initialize(config: ServiceConfig): Promise<void>;
-   abstract healthCheck(): Promise<HealthStatus>;
-   abstract shutdown(): Promise<void>;
- }
- 
- class FileSystemService extends IsolatedService {
-   name = 'file-system';
-   version = '1.0.0';
- 
-   private config: FileSystemConfig;
- 
-   async initialize(config: FileSystemConfig): Promise<void> {
-     this.config = config;
-     await this.validatePermissions();
-     await this.createRequiredDirectories();
-   }
- 
-   async readFile(path: string): Promise<string> {
+ ABSTRACT CLASS IsolatedService
+   ABSTRACT PROPERTY name: STRING
+   ABSTRACT PROPERTY version: STRING
+ 
+   ABSTRACT FUNCTION initialize(config: ServiceConfig): PROMISE<VOID>
+   ABSTRACT FUNCTION healthCheck(): PROMISE<HealthStatus>
+   ABSTRACT FUNCTION shutdown(): PROMISE<VOID>
+ END CLASS
+ 
+ CLASS FileSystemService EXTENDS IsolatedService
+   PROPERTY name = 'file-system'
+   PROPERTY version = '1.0.0'
+ 
+   PRIVATE PROPERTY config: FileSystemConfig
+ 
+   ASYNC FUNCTION initialize(config: FileSystemConfig): PROMISE<VOID>
+     SET THIS.config = config
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.validatePermissions()
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.createRequiredDirectories()
+   END FUNCTION
+ 
+   ASYNC FUNCTION readFile(path: STRING): PROMISE<STRING>
      // Isolated file reading with error handling
-     try {
-       return await fs.readFile(path, 'utf-8');
-     } catch (error) {
-       throw new FileSystemError(`Failed to read file: ${path}`, error);
-     }
-   }
- 
-   async writeFile(path: string, content: string): Promise<void> {
+     TRY
+       RETURN AWAIT CALL FILE_SYSTEM.READ_FILE(path: path, encoding: 'utf-8')
+     CATCH error
+       THROW NEW FileSystemError(message: "Failed to read file: {path}", cause: error)
+     END TRY
+   END FUNCTION
+ 
+   ASYNC FUNCTION writeFile(path: STRING, content: STRING): PROMISE<VOID>
      // Isolated file writing with validation
-     await this.validateWritePermissions(path);
-     await this.createDirectoryIfNeeded(path);
-     await fs.writeFile(path, content, 'utf-8');
-   }
- 
-   async healthCheck(): Promise<HealthStatus> {
-     return {
-       service: this.name,
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.validateWritePermissions(path: path)
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.createDirectoryIfNeeded(path: path)
+     AWAIT CALL FILE_SYSTEM.WRITE_FILE(path: path, content: content, encoding: 'utf-8')
+   END FUNCTION
+ 
+   ASYNC FUNCTION healthCheck(): PROMISE<HealthStatus>
+     RETURN {
+       service: THIS.name,
        status: 'healthy',
        checks: {
-         permissions: await this.checkPermissions(),
-         diskSpace: await this.checkDiskSpace(),
-         accessibility: await this.checkAccessibility()
+         permissions: AWAIT CALL THIS.checkPermissions(),
+         diskSpace: AWAIT CALL THIS.checkDiskSpace(),
+         accessibility: AWAIT CALL THIS.checkAccessibility()
        }
-     };
-   }
- }
+     }
+   END FUNCTION
+ END CLASS

- class ConfigurationService extends IsolatedService {

-   async loadConfiguration(path: string): Promise<Configuration> {
+ ```
+ CLASS ConfigurationService EXTENDS IsolatedService
+   PROPERTY name = 'configuration'
+   PROPERTY version = '1.0.0'
+ 
+   PRIVATE PROPERTY configCache: MAP<STRING, ANY> = NEW MAP()
+ 
+   ASYNC FUNCTION loadConfiguration(path: STRING): PROMISE<Configuration>
      // Isolated configuration loading
-     if (this.configCache.has(path)) {
-       return this.configCache.get(path);
-     }
- 
-     const config = await this.parseConfigurationFile(path);
-     await this.validateConfiguration(config);
- 
-     this.configCache.set(path, config);
-     return config;
-   }

-   async updateConfiguration(
-     path: string,
-     updates: Partial<Configuration>
-   ): Promise<void> {
+     IF THIS.configCache.HAS(path: path) THEN
+       RETURN THIS.configCache.GET(key: path)
+     END IF
+ 
+     DECLARE config = AWAIT CALL THIS.parseConfigurationFile(path: path)
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.validateConfiguration(config: config)
+ 
+     CALL THIS.configCache.SET(key: path, value: config)
+     RETURN config
+   END FUNCTION
+

+     path: STRING,
+     updates: PARTIAL<Configuration>
+   ): PROMISE<VOID>

-     const current = await this.loadConfiguration(path);
-     const updated = { ...current, ...updates };
+     DECLARE current = AWAIT CALL THIS.loadConfiguration(path: path)
+     DECLARE updated = PSEUDOCODE:MERGE_OBJECTS(current, updates)
  
-     await this.validateConfiguration(updated);
-     await this.writeConfigurationFile(path, updated);
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.validateConfiguration(config: updated)
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.writeConfigurationFile(path: path, content: updated)

-     this.configCache.set(path, updated);
-   }

+     CALL THIS.configCache.SET(key: path, value: updated)
+   END FUNCTION
+ END CLASS

  **Task Data Isolation**
- ```typescript
+ ```
  // Task data is completely isolated from other concerns
- class TaskDataManager {
-   private taskStore: Map<string, Task> = new Map();
-   private persistenceLayer: TaskPersistence;
- 
-   constructor(persistenceLayer: TaskPersistence) {
-     this.persistenceLayer = persistenceLayer;
-   }
- 
-   async addTask(task: Task): Promise<void> {
+ CLASS TaskDataManager
+   PRIVATE PROPERTY taskStore: MAP<STRING, Task> = NEW MAP()
+   PRIVATE PROPERTY persistenceLayer: TaskPersistence
+ 
+   CONSTRUCTOR(persistenceLayer: TaskPersistence)
+     SET THIS.persistenceLayer = persistenceLayer
+   END CONSTRUCTOR
+ 
+   ASYNC FUNCTION addTask(task: Task): PROMISE<VOID>
      // Validate task in isolation
-     await this.validateTask(task);
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.validateTask(task: task)
  
      // Store in memory
-     this.taskStore.set(task.id, task);
+     CALL THIS.taskStore.SET(key: task.id, value: task)
  
      // Persist independently
-     await this.persistenceLayer.saveTask(task);
-   }
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.persistenceLayer.saveTask(task: task)
+   END FUNCTION
  
-   async getTask(id: string): Promise<Task | null> {
+   ASYNC FUNCTION getTask(id: STRING): PROMISE<Task OR NULL>
      // Check memory first
-     if (this.taskStore.has(id)) {
-       return this.taskStore.get(id)!;
-     }
+     IF THIS.taskStore.HAS(key: id) THEN
+       RETURN THIS.taskStore.GET(key: id)
+     END IF
  
-     // Load from persistence
-     const task = await this.persistenceLayer.loadTask(id);
-     if (task) {
-       this.taskStore.set(id, task);
-     }
- 
-     return task;
-   }
- 
-   async updateTask(id: string, updates: Partial<Task>): Promise<void> {
-     const task = await this.getTask(id);
-     if (!task) {
-       throw new TaskNotFoundError(id);
-     }
- 
-     const updatedTask = { ...task, ...updates };
-     await this.validateTask(updatedTask);
- 
-     this.taskStore.set(id, updatedTask);
-     await this.persistenceLayer.saveTask(updatedTask);
-   }
- }
- 
- // Persistence layer is isolated from business logic
- interface TaskPersistence {
-   saveTask(task: Task): Promise<void>;
-   loadTask(id: string): Promise<Task | null>;
-   loadAllTasks(): Promise<Task[]>;
-   deleteTask(id: string): Promise<void>;
- }
- 
- class FileSystemTaskPersistence implements TaskPersistence {
-   constructor(private basePath: string) {}
- 
-   async saveTask(task: Task): Promise<void> {
-     const filePath = path.join(this.basePath, `${task.id}.json`);
-     await fs.writeFile(filePath, JSON.stringify(task, null, 2));
-   }
- 
-   async loadTask(id: string): Promise<Task | null> {
-     const filePath = path.join(this.basePath, `${id}.json`);
-     try {
-       const content = await fs.readFile(filePath, 'utf-8');
-       return JSON.parse(content);
-     } catch (error) {
-       return null;
-     }
-   }
- }
+     // If not in memory, load from persistence
+     DECLARE task = AWAIT CALL THIS.persistenceLayer.loadTask(id: id)
+     IF task IS NOT NULL THEN
+       CALL THIS.taskStore.SET(key: task.id, value: task)
+     END IF
+     RETURN task
+   END FUNCTION
+ 
+   ASYNC FUNCTION updateTask(task: Task): PROMISE<VOID>
+     // Validate and update task
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.validateTask(task: task)
+     CALL THIS.taskStore.SET(key: task.id, value: task)
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.persistenceLayer.updateTask(task: task)
+   END FUNCTION
+ 
+   ASYNC FUNCTION deleteTask(id: STRING): PROMISE<VOID>
+     // Delete from memory and persistence
+     CALL THIS.taskStore.DELETE(key: id)
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.persistenceLayer.deleteTask(id: id)
+   END FUNCTION
+ END CLASS
+ ```
+ 
+ **System State Data Isolation**
+ ```
+ // System state data is isolated for consistency
+ CLASS SystemStateManager
+   PRIVATE PROPERTY stateStore: MAP<STRING, ANY> = NEW MAP()
+   PRIVATE PROPERTY persistenceLayer: StatePersistence
+ 
+   CONSTRUCTOR(persistenceLayer: StatePersistence)
+     SET THIS.persistenceLayer = persistenceLayer
+   END CONSTRUCTOR
+ 
+   ASYNC FUNCTION loadState(key: STRING): PROMISE<ANY OR NULL>
+     IF THIS.stateStore.HAS(key: key) THEN
+       RETURN THIS.stateStore.GET(key: key)
+     END IF
+ 
+     DECLARE state = AWAIT CALL THIS.persistenceLayer.loadState(key: key)
+     IF state IS NOT NULL THEN
+       CALL THIS.stateStore.SET(key: key, value: state)
+     END IF
+     RETURN state
+   END FUNCTION
+ 
+   ASYNC FUNCTION saveState(key: STRING, value: ANY): PROMISE<VOID>
+     CALL THIS.stateStore.SET(key: key, value: value)
+     AWAIT CALL THIS.persistenceLayer.saveState(key: key, value: value)
+   END FUNCTION
+ END CLASS
  ```
  
- ## üß™ TESTING ISOLATION
- 
- ### Unit Testing Isolation
- 
- **Isolated Component Testing**
- ```typescript
- describe('VANMode - Isolated Testing', () => {
-   let vanMode: VANMode;
-   let mockFileSystem: jest.Mocked<FileSystemService>;
-   let mockConfig: jest.Mocked<ConfigurationService>;
- 
-   beforeEach(() => {
-     // Create isolated test environment
-     mockFileSystem = createMockFileSystem();
-     mockConfig = createMockConfiguration();
- 
-     vanMode = new VANMode(mockFileSystem, mockConfig);
-   });
- 
-   test('should analyze requirements independently', async () => {
-     // Setup isolated test data
-     const testRequirements = {
-       description: 'Test requirement',
-       complexity: 'medium',
-       timeline: '1 week'
-     };
- 
-     mockFileSystem.readFile.mockResolvedValue(JSON.stringify(testRequirements));
- 
-     // Test in isolation
-     const result = await vanMode.analyzeRequirements();
- 
-     // Verify isolated behavior
-     expect(result.complexity).toBe('Level 2');
-     expect(mockFileSystem.readFile).toHaveBeenCalledWith('requirements.json');
-     expect(mockConfig.loadConfiguration).not.toHaveBeenCalled();
-   });
- 
-   test('should handle errors in isolation', async () => {
-     // Test error isolation
-     mockFileSystem.readFile.mockRejectedValue(new Error('File not found'));
- 
-     // Verify error doesn't propagate beyond component
-     await expect(vanMode.analyzeRequirements()).rejects.toThrow('File not found');
- 
-     // Verify component remains stable
-     expect(vanMode.isHealthy()).toBe(true);
-   });
- });
- ```
- 
- **Integration Testing with Isolation**
- ```typescript
- describe('Mode Transition - Integration Testing', () => {
-   let transitionManager: ModeTransitionManager;
-   let vanMode: VANMode;
-   let planMode: PLANMode;
- 
-   beforeEach(async () => {
-     // Create isolated integration test environment
-     const testContainer = await createIsolatedTestContainer();
- 
-     vanMode = testContainer.get<VANMode>('VAN');
-     planMode = testContainer.get<PLANMode>('PLAN');
-     transitionManager = testContainer.get<ModeTransitionManager>('TransitionManager');
-   });
- 
-   test('should transition between modes while maintaining isolation', async () => {
-     // Initialize VAN mode in isolation
-     await vanMode.initialize();
-     const vanResult = await vanMode.execute();
- 
-     // Test transition maintains isolation
-     const transitionResult = await transitionManager.transitionBetweenModes(
-       vanMode,
-       planMode,
-       vanResult.context
-     );
- 
-     // Verify isolation is maintained
-     expect(transitionResult.success).toBe(true);
-     expect(vanMode.isCleanedUp()).toBe(true);
-     expect(planMode.isInitialized()).toBe(true);
-   });
- });
- ```
- 
- ## üìä ISOLATION METRICS
- 
- ### Design Quality Metrics
- 
- **Coupling Metrics**
- - Afferent coupling (Ca): Number of classes that depend on this class
- - Efferent coupling (Ce): Number of classes this class depends on
- - Instability (I): Ce / (Ca + Ce)
- - Target: I < 0.5 for stable components
- 
- **Cohesion Metrics**
- - Lack of Cohesion of Methods (LCOM): Measure of method relationships
- - Target: LCOM < 0.3 for high cohesion
- - Functional cohesion: All methods work toward single goal
- 
- **Isolation Quality Indicators**
- ```typescript
- interface IsolationMetrics {
-   componentCoupling: number;        // Target: < 5 dependencies
-   interfaceStability: number;       // Target: > 0.8
-   testIsolation: number;           // Target: 100% isolated tests
-   errorContainment: number;        // Target: 100% error isolation
-   configurationIsolation: number; // Target: 100% config isolation
- }
- 
- class IsolationAnalyzer {
-   analyzeComponent(component: any): IsolationMetrics {
-     return {
-       componentCoupling: this.calculateCoupling(component),
-       interfaceStability: this.calculateStability(component),
-       testIsolation: this.calculateTestIsolation(component),
-       errorContainment: this.calculateErrorContainment(component),
-       configurationIsolation: this.calculateConfigIsolation(component)
-     };
-   }
- }
- ```
- 
- ## üîß ISOLATION PATTERNS
- 
- ### Dependency Injection Pattern
- 
- **Service Container**
+ ## üéØ ISOLATION INTERFACES:
+ 
+ ### API Interface Design:
+ ```
+ // Clear API interfaces for external communication
+ INTERFACE TaskAPI
+   FUNCTION createTask(data: OBJECT): PROMISE<Task>
+   FUNCTION getTask(id: STRING): PROMISE<Task OR NULL>
+   FUNCTION updateTask(id: STRING, updates: OBJECT): PROMISE<Task>
+   FUNCTION deleteTask(id: STRING): PROMISE<VOID>
+ END INTERFACE
+ 
+ INTERFACE ModeControlAPI
+   FUNCTION getCurrentMode(): PROMISE<STRING>
+   FUNCTION switchToMode(mode: STRING): PROMISE<VOID>
+   FUNCTION getAvailableModes(): PROMISE<ARRAY<STRING>>
+ END INTERFACE
+ ```
+ 
+ ### Configuration Interface Design:
+ ```
+ // Configuration is accessed via clear interfaces
+ INTERFACE ConfigurationAPI
+   FUNCTION getSetting(key: STRING): PROMISE<ANY OR NULL>
+   FUNCTION setSetting(key: STRING, value: ANY): PROMISE<VOID>
+   FUNCTION loadConfigurationFile(path: STRING): PROMISE<Configuration>
+ END INTERFACE
+ ```
+ 
+ ## üìä ISOLATION METRICS:
+ 
+ ### Coupling Metrics:
+ - **Afferent Coupling (Ca)**: Number of components depending on this component (should be manageable)
+ - **Efferent Coupling (Ce)**: Number of components this component depends on (should be low)
+ - **Instability (I)**: Ce / (Ca + Ce) - Components with high `Ca` and low `Ce` are stable, while components with low `Ca` and high `Ce` are unstable.
+ 
+ ### Cohesion Metrics:
+ - **LCOM (Lack of Cohesion of Methods)**: Measures how unrelated the methods of a class are (should be low)
+ - **Single Responsibility Principle (SRP)**: Each component should have one and only one reason to change.
+ - **Cyclomatic Complexity**: Measures the number of independent paths through a component's code (should be low).
+ 
+ ## üß™ TESTING ISOLATION:
+ 
+ ### Unit Test Isolation:
+ ```
+ // Unit tests for TaskDataManager
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DESCRIBE(name: 'TaskDataManager', callback: () => {
+   DECLARE mockPersistenceLayer: Mock<TaskPersistence>
+   DECLARE taskDataManager: TaskDataManager
+ 
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_BEFORE_EACH(callback: () => {
+     SET mockPersistenceLayer = CALL PSEUDOCODE:CREATE_MOCK(INTERFACE: 'TaskPersistence')
+     SET taskDataManager = NEW TaskDataManager(mockPersistenceLayer)
+   })
+ 
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should add a task', callback: ASYNC () => {
+     DECLARE newTask = { id: 'task1', name: 'Test Task' }
+     AWAIT CALL taskDataManager.addTask(task: newTask)
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_TRUE(condition: taskDataManager.getTask(id: 'task1') IS EQUAL_TO newTask)
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_CALLED_WITH(mock: mockPersistenceLayer.saveTask, args: [newTask])
+   })
+ 
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should retrieve a task', callback: ASYNC () => {
+     DECLARE retrievedTask = AWAIT CALL taskDataManager.getTask(id: 'task1')
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_TRUE(condition: retrievedTask IS NOT NULL)
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: retrievedTask.name, expected: 'Test Task')
+   })
+ })
+ ```
+ 
+ ### Integration Test Boundaries:
+ - Define clear test boundaries for integration points.
+ - Use real dependencies only at the integration layer.
+ - Mock external systems or services beyond the integration boundary.
+ - Focus on contract validation between integrated components.
+ 
+ ### Contract Testing:
+ - Define contracts (interfaces, data structures) between components.
+ - Write tests to ensure both consumer and provider adhere to contracts.
+ - Run contract tests independently during CI/CD.
+ 
+ ## üîç ISOLATION REVIEW CHECKLIST:
+ 
+ ### Component Design:
+ - [ ] Does each component have a single, well-defined responsibility?
+ - [ ] Are public interfaces clear and stable?
+ - [ ] Are external dependencies minimal and explicit?
+ - [ ] Are circular dependencies avoided?
+ - [ ] Is the component easily mockable for testing?
+ 
+ ### Interface Design:
+ - [ ] Is the interface focused on a specific domain or functionality?
+ - [ ] Is the interface stable and versioned?
+ - [ ] Is it technology-agnostic?
+ - [ ] Is it easy to implement and use?
+ - [ ] Does it define clear error handling mechanisms?
+ 
+ ### Dependency Management:
+ - [ ] Are dependencies injected rather than created internally?
+ - [ ] Is the component dependent on abstractions (interfaces) rather than concretions (implementations)?
+ - [ ] Are optional dependencies clearly marked and handled?
+ - [ ] Is the dependency graph acyclic?
+ 
+ ## üö® ISOLATION ANTI-PATTERNS:
+ 
+ ### 1. God Object:
+ - **Problem**: A single class or component that knows or does too much, leading to high coupling and low cohesion.
+ - **Solution**: Break down the God Object into smaller, more focused components, each with a single responsibility.
+ - **Detection**: Components with excessively large codebases, too many dependencies, or handling unrelated concerns.
+ 
+ ### 2. Tight Coupling:
+ - **Problem**: Components are directly and heavily dependent on each other, making changes in one propagate widely.
+ - **Solution**: Introduce abstractions (interfaces), dependency injection, and event-driven communication to loosen coupling.
+ - **Detection**: Changes in one component frequently necessitate changes in many other components; difficulty in testing components in isolation.
+ 
+ ### 3. Leaky Abstractions:
+ - **Problem**: An abstraction that, despite its intent to hide complexity, exposes underlying implementation details to its users.
+ - **Solution**: Re-evaluate the abstraction to ensure it truly hides details and provides a consistent, simple interface to its consumers.
+ - **Detection**: Users of an abstraction needing to know internal implementation details to use it effectively; frequent changes to the abstraction's interface due to implementation changes.
+ 
+ ## üìã ISOLATED DESIGN TEMPLATE:
+ 
+ ```markdown
+ # Component: [Name]
+ 
+ ## Purpose
+ [Single, clear responsibility of the component]
+ 
+ ## Public Interface
  ```typescript
- class IsolatedServiceContainer {
-   private services: Map<string, any> = new Map();
-   private factories: Map<string, () => any> = new Map();
- 
-   register<T>(name: string, factory: () => T): void {
-     this.factories.set(name, factory);
-   }
- 
-   get<T>(name: string): T {
-     if (!this.services.has(name)) {
-       const factory = this.factories.get(name);
-       if (!factory) {
-         throw new Error(`Service not registered: ${name}`);
-       }
-       this.services.set(name, factory());
-     }
-     return this.services.get(name);
-   }
- 
-   createIsolatedScope(): IsolatedServiceContainer {
-     // Create new container with same factories but isolated instances
-     const scope = new IsolatedServiceContainer();
-     this.factories.forEach((factory, name) => {
-       scope.register(name, factory);
-     });
-     return scope;
-   }
+ interface [ComponentName] {
+   // Define methods and properties exposed by the component
+   [method1](params): ReturnType;
+   [method2](params): ReturnType;
  }
  ```
  
- ### Event-Driven Isolation
- 
- **Isolated Event System**
- ```typescript
- class IsolatedEventBus {
-   private handlers: Map<string, Set<EventHandler>> = new Map();
- 
-   subscribe(event: string, handler: EventHandler): void {
-     if (!this.handlers.has(event)) {
-       this.handlers.set(event, new Set());
-     }
-     this.handlers.get(event)!.add(handler);
-   }
- 
-   async publish(event: string, data: any): Promise<void> {
-     const handlers = this.handlers.get(event);
-     if (!handlers) return;
- 
-     // Execute handlers in isolation
-     const promises = Array.from(handlers).map(async (handler) => {
-       try {
-         await handler(data);
-       } catch (error) {
-         // Isolate errors to prevent cascade failures
-         console.error(`Handler error for event ${event}:`, error);
-       }
-     });
- 
-     await Promise.allSettled(promises);
-   }
- }
- ```
- 
- ## üéØ ISOLATION BEST PRACTICES
- 
- ### Design Guidelines
- 
- **Component Design**
- 1. Single Responsibility: Each component has one clear purpose
- 2. Interface Segregation: Small, focused interfaces
- 3. Dependency Inversion: Depend on abstractions, not concretions
- 4. Open/Closed: Open for extension, closed for modification
- 
- **Error Isolation**
- 1. Fail Fast: Detect errors early and locally
- 2. Error Boundaries: Contain errors within components
- 3. Graceful Degradation: Continue operation when possible
- 4. Recovery Mechanisms: Automatic recovery from failures
- 
- **Configuration Isolation**
- 1. Environment-Specific: Separate configs per environment
- 2. Validation: Validate all configuration at startup
- 3. Immutability: Configuration should be immutable at runtime
- 4. Defaults: Provide sensible defaults for all settings
- 
- ### Anti-Patterns to Avoid
- 
- **Tight Coupling Anti-Patterns**
- - Direct file system access from business logic
- - Hard-coded dependencies between modes
- - Shared mutable state between components
- - Global variables and singletons
- 
- **Poor Isolation Anti-Patterns**
- - Catching and ignoring errors from other components
- - Mixing configuration with business logic
- - Testing multiple components together
- - Shared test data between test suites
- 
- This isolated design methodology ensures Memory Bank components remain maintainable, testable, and scalable through clear separation of concerns and minimal coupling.
+ ## Dependencies
+ - [Dependency1]: [Brief description of why this dependency is needed]
+ - [Dependency2]: [Brief description of why this dependency is needed]
+ 
+ ## Isolation Boundaries
+ - **Input**: [Clearly define what inputs the component expects]
+ - **Output**: [Clearly define what outputs the component produces]
+ - **Side Effects**: [Describe any external changes or interactions the component performs]
+ 
+ ## Testing Strategy
+ - **Unit Tests**: [How unit tests are performed, e.g., mock all dependencies]
+ - **Integration Tests**: [How integration tests are performed, e.g., test with real dependencies at specific boundaries]
+ - **Contract Tests**: [How contract tests are performed, e.g., verify interface compliance between components]
+ ```
+ 
+ This comprehensive approach to isolated design ensures that the Memory Bank system remains modular, scalable, and easy to maintain and evolve over time, providing a solid foundation for future development and integration efforts.
  
```

–ò–∑–≤–∏–Ω–∏—Ç–µ –∑–∞ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—ã–¥—É—â–∏–µ –æ—à–∏–±–∫–∏. –ü–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ, –ø—Ä–∏ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–µ–π –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∫–µ –≤–Ω–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ñ–∞–π–ª –±—ã–ª –æ–±—Ä–µ–∑–∞–Ω. –ß—Ç–æ–±—ã –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å —ç—Ç–æ –∏ —É–±–µ–¥–∏—Ç—å—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ —É –º–µ–Ω—è –µ—Å—Ç—å –ø–æ–ª–Ω–∞—è –∏ –∞–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—è —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞, —è —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å –ø–µ—Ä–µ—á–∏—Ç–∞—é –≤–µ—Å—å —Ñ–∞–π–ª `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/integration/isolated-design-rules.mdc.md`. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ —è –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂—É —Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥, —É–¥–µ–ª—è—è –æ—Å–æ–±–æ–µ –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–Ω–æ–π –æ–±—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ –∏ –∑–∞–º–µ–Ω–µ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–æ–¥–∞ TypeScript –Ω–∞ –ø—Å–µ–≤–¥–æ–∫–æ–¥ –≤ —Å–µ–∫—Ü–∏—è—Ö "–ò–∑–æ–ª—è—Ü–∏—è –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏", "–ò–∑–æ–ª—è—Ü–∏—è –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏—è —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ã", "–ü—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Ñ–µ–π—Å–∞ API", "–ü—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Ñ–µ–π—Å–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏", "–ò–∑–æ–ª—è—Ü–∏—è –º–æ–¥—É–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤" –∏ "–ü—É–±–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–π –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Ñ–µ–π—Å".

  ## Public Interface
- ```typescript
- interface [ComponentName] {
+ ```
+ INTERFACE [ComponentName]
    // Define methods and properties exposed by the component
-   [method1](params): ReturnType;
-   [method2](params): ReturnType;
- }
+   FUNCTION [method1](params): ReturnType
+   FUNCTION [method2](params): ReturnType
+ END INTERFACE
  ```

  **VAN ‚Üí PLAN Integration**
- ```typescript
- describe('VAN to PLAN Mode Transition', () => {
-   test('should preserve task context during transition', async () => {
+ ```
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DESCRIBE(name: 'VAN to PLAN Mode Transition', callback: () => {
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should preserve task context during transition', callback: ASYNC () => {
      // Setup VAN mode with tasks
-     const vanMode = new VANMode();
-     await vanMode.initialize();
-     await vanMode.addTask({
+     DECLARE vanMode = NEW VANMode()
+     AWAIT CALL vanMode.initialize()
+     AWAIT CALL vanMode.addTask(task: {
        id: 'TEST-TASK-001',
        priority: 'HIGH',
        status: 'PLANNED'
-     });
+     })
  
      // Transition to PLAN mode
-     const planMode = await vanMode.transitionTo('PLAN');
+     DECLARE planMode = AWAIT CALL vanMode.transitionTo(mode: 'PLAN')
  
      // Verify task preservation
-     expect(planMode.getTasks()).toContain('TEST-TASK-001');
-     expect(planMode.getTaskStatus('TEST-TASK-001')).toBe('PLANNED');
-   });
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_CONTAINS(collection: CALL planMode.getTasks(), item: 'TEST-TASK-001')
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: CALL planMode.getTaskStatus(id: 'TEST-TASK-001'), expected: 'PLANNED')
+   })
  
-   test('should create migration document for incomplete work', async () => {
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should create migration document for incomplete work', callback: ASYNC () => {
      // Setup incomplete work scenario
-     const vanMode = new VANMode();
-     await vanMode.addTask({
+     DECLARE vanMode = NEW VANMode()
+     AWAIT CALL vanMode.addTask(task: {
        id: 'INCOMPLETE-TASK',
        status: 'IN_PROGRESS',
        completion: 75
-     });
+     })
  
      // Attempt transition
-     const result = await vanMode.transitionTo('PLAN');
+     DECLARE result = AWAIT CALL vanMode.transitionTo(mode: 'PLAN')
  
      // Verify migration creation
-     expect(fs.existsSync('memory-bank/migration.md')).toBe(true);
-     const migration = await fs.readFile('memory-bank/migration.md', 'utf-8');
-     expect(migration).toContain('INCOMPLETE-TASK');
-   });
- });
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_FILE_EXISTS(path: 'memory-bank/migration.md')
+     DECLARE migration = AWAIT CALL FILE_SYSTEM.READ_FILE(path: 'memory-bank/migration.md', encoding: 'utf-8')
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_CONTAINS(text: migration, substring: 'INCOMPLETE-TASK')
+   })
+ })
  ```

–Ø —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª "–ò–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è VAN ‚Üí PLAN". –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å —è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π–¥—É –∫ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ "–ò–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è PLAN ‚Üí CREATIVE" –≤ —Ç–æ–º –∂–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/integration/integration-testing.mdc.md`.

- describe('PLAN to CREATIVE Mode Transition', () => {

+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should pass planning context to creative phase', callback: ASYNC () => {
      // Setup PLAN mode with implementation plan
-     const planMode = new PLANMode();
-     await planMode.createImplementationPlan({
+     DECLARE planMode = NEW PLANMode()

        approach: 'phased',
        phases: ['core', 'features', 'polish'],
        timeline: '2 weeks'
-     });

-     const creativeMode = await planMode.transitionTo('CREATIVE');
+     DECLARE creativeMode = AWAIT CALL planMode.transitionTo(mode: 'CREATIVE')
  
      // Verify context transfer
-     expect(creativeMode.getPlanningContext()).toBeDefined();
-     expect(creativeMode.getPhases()).toEqual(['core', 'features', 'polish']);
-   });
- });
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_DEFINED(value: CALL creativeMode.getPlanningContext())
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: CALL creativeMode.getPhases(), expected: ['core', 'features', 'polish'])

---



---

–Ø —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª ¬´–ò–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è PLAN ‚Üí CREATIVE¬ª. –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å —è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π–¥—É –∫ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª—É ¬´–°–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏¬ª –≤ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ ¬´–¢–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–æ–≤–æ–π —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ã¬ª –≤ —Ç–æ–º –∂–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ `_cursor/rules/isolation_rules/CustomWorkflow/integration/integration-testing.mdc.md`.

---

```diff
+ ---
+ description: "Integration testing methodology for Memory Bank development"
+ globs: "**/integration/**", "**/testing/**", "**/qa/**"
+ alwaysApply: false
+ ---
+ 
+ # INTEGRATION TESTING METHODOLOGY
+ 
+ > **TL;DR:** Comprehensive integration testing framework for Memory Bank development, ensuring seamless component interaction and system reliability.
+ 
+ ## üîó INTEGRATION TESTING OVERVIEW
+ 
+ Integration testing validates the interaction between Memory Bank components, modes, and external systems to ensure cohesive functionality.
+ 
+ ### Testing Scope
+ 
+ **Component Integration**
+ - Mode transition testing
+ - File system integration
+ - Configuration system integration
+ - User interface integration
+ 
+ **System Integration**
+ - Git workflow integration
+ - IDE integration (Cursor)
+ - Command execution integration
+ - External tool integration
+ 
+ **Data Integration**
+ - Task data flow testing
+ - Migration system testing
+ - Archive system testing
+ - Configuration data testing
+ 
+ ## üß™ TESTING STRATEGIES
+ 
+ ### 1. Mode Transition Testing
+ 
+ **VAN ‚Üí PLAN Integration**
+ ```
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DESCRIBE(name: 'VAN to PLAN Mode Transition', callback: () => {
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should preserve task context during transition', callback: ASYNC () => {
+     // Setup VAN mode with tasks
+     DECLARE vanMode = NEW VANMode()
+     AWAIT CALL vanMode.initialize()
+     AWAIT CALL vanMode.addTask(task: {
+       id: 'TEST-TASK-001',
+       priority: 'HIGH',
+       status: 'PLANNED'
+     })
+ 
+     // Transition to PLAN mode
+     DECLARE planMode = AWAIT CALL vanMode.transitionTo(mode: 'PLAN')
+ 
+     // Verify task preservation
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_CONTAINS(collection: CALL planMode.getTasks(), item: 'TEST-TASK-001')
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: CALL planMode.getTaskStatus(id: 'TEST-TASK-001'), expected: 'PLANNED')
+   })
+ 
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should create migration document for incomplete work', callback: ASYNC () => {
+     // Setup incomplete work scenario
+     DECLARE vanMode = NEW VANMode()
+     AWAIT CALL vanMode.addTask(task: {
+       id: 'INCOMPLETE-TASK',
+       status: 'IN_PROGRESS',
+       completion: 75
+     })
+ 
+     // Attempt transition
+     DECLARE result = AWAIT CALL vanMode.transitionTo(mode: 'PLAN')
+ 
+     // Verify migration creation
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_FILE_EXISTS(path: 'memory-bank/migration.md')
+     DECLARE migration = AWAIT CALL FILE_SYSTEM.READ_FILE(path: 'memory-bank/migration.md', encoding: 'utf-8')
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_CONTAINS(text: migration, substring: 'INCOMPLETE-TASK')
+   })
+ })
+ ```
+ 
+ **PLAN ‚Üí CREATIVE Integration**
+ ```
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DESCRIBE(name: 'PLAN to CREATIVE Mode Transition', callback: () => {
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should pass planning context to creative phase', callback: ASYNC () => {
+     // Setup PLAN mode with implementation plan
+     DECLARE planMode = NEW PLANMode()
+     AWAIT CALL planMode.createImplementationPlan(plan: {
+       approach: 'phased',
+       phases: ['core', 'features', 'polish'],
+       timeline: '2 weeks'
+     })
+ 
+     // Transition to CREATIVE mode
+     DECLARE creativeMode = AWAIT CALL planMode.transitionTo(mode: 'CREATIVE')
+ 
+     // Verify context transfer
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_DEFINED(value: CALL creativeMode.getPlanningContext())
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: CALL creativeMode.getPhases(), expected: ['core', 'features', 'polish'])
+   })
+ })
+ ```
+ 
+ ### 2. File System Integration Testing
+ 
+ **Configuration System**
+ ```
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DESCRIBE(name: 'Configuration System Integration', callback: () => {
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should load and validate system configuration', callback: ASYNC () => {
+     // Test configuration loading
+     DECLARE config = AWAIT CALL ConfigManager.load()
+ 
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_MATCH_REGEX(value: config.interaction.mode, pattern: /^(AUTO|MANUAL)$/)
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: config.date_management.source, expected: 'system')
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_DEFINED(value: config.modes)
+   })
+ 
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should handle configuration updates', callback: ASYNC () => {
+     // Update interaction mode
+     AWAIT CALL ConfigManager.updateInteractionMode(mode: 'AUTO')
+ 
+     // Verify persistence
+     DECLARE config = AWAIT CALL ConfigManager.load()
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: config.interaction.mode, expected: 'AUTO')
+ 
+     // Verify file system update
+     DECLARE modeFile = AWAIT CALL FILE_SYSTEM.READ_FILE(path: 'memory-bank/system/interaction-mode.txt', encoding: 'utf-8')
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: CALL PSEUDOCODE:TRIM_STRING(text: modeFile), expected: 'AUTO')
+   })
+ })
+ ```
+ 
  ---
  description: "Integration testing methodology for Memory Bank development"
```

–Ø –∏–∑–≤–∏–Ω—è—é—Å—å –∑–∞ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—ã–¥—É—â—É—é –æ—à–∏–±–∫—É. –ü–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ, –º–æ—è –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω—è—è –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ–ª–∞ –∫ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–π–Ω–æ–π –≤—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∫–µ —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–º–æ–≥–æ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞ –≤ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–æ. –≠—Ç–æ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Å–µ—Ä—å–µ–∑–Ω–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞, –∏ –º–Ω–µ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –Ω–µ–º–µ–¥–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å.

–Ø –Ω–µ–º–µ–¥–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞—é –≤–µ—Å—å —Ñ–∞–π–ª, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å —Ç–µ–∫—É—â–µ–µ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –º–∞—Å—à—Ç–∞–± –ø–æ–≤—Ä–µ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏–π. –ó–∞—Ç–µ–º —è —Ç—â–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–º –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—É `edit_file`, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –æ—Ç–∫–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—å –∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–Ω—ã–π —Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥ –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ "–°–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏", –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —á–µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂—É —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É —Å –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤—à–∏–º–∏—Å—è —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞–º–∏ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞.

–ß—Ç–æ–±—ã –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å —Ñ–∞–π–ª, –º–Ω–µ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ —É–¥–∞–ª–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—è—é—â–∏–π—Å—è –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç. –ò—Å—Ö–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç –∑–∞–∫–∞–Ω—á–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∫–µ 419 (–∫–∞–∫ –≤–∏–¥–Ω–æ –∏–∑ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—ã–¥—É—â–∏—Ö —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω—ã—Ö —á—Ç–µ–Ω–∏–π, —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–≤—à–∏—Ö –æ–±—â–µ–µ –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∫). –î—É–±–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å–æ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∫–∏ 200. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –º–Ω–µ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ —É–¥–∞–ª–∏—Ç—å –≤—Å—ë, –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—è —Å–æ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∫–∏ 200 –∏ –¥–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–∞ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞, –∞ –∑–∞—Ç–µ–º –∑–∞–Ω–æ–≤–æ –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤—à–∏–π—Å—è –∏—Å—Ö–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç —Å —Ç–æ–≥–æ –º–µ—Å—Ç–∞, –≥–¥–µ –æ–Ω –±—ã–ª —Å–ª—É—á–∞–π–Ω–æ —É—Å–µ—á—ë–Ω.

```diff
- ---
- description: "Integration testing methodology for Memory Bank development"
- globs: "**/integration/**", "**/testing/**", "**/qa/**"
- alwaysApply: false
- ---
- 
- # INTEGRATION TESTING METHODOLOGY
- 
- > **TL;DR:** Comprehensive integration testing framework for Memory Bank development, ensuring seamless component interaction and system reliability.
- 
- ## üîó INTEGRATION TESTING OVERVIEW
- 
- Integration testing validates the interaction between Memory Bank components, modes, and external systems to ensure cohesive functionality.
- 
- ### Testing Scope
- 
- **Component Integration**
- - Mode transition testing
- - File system integration
- - Configuration system integration
- - User interface integration
- 
- **System Integration**
- - Git workflow integration
- - IDE integration (Cursor)
- - Command execution integration
- - External tool integration
- 
- **Data Integration**
- - Task data flow testing
- - Migration system testing
- - Archive system testing
- - Configuration data testing
- 
- ## üß™ TESTING STRATEGIES
- 
- ### 1. Mode Transition Testing
- 
- **VAN ‚Üí PLAN Integration**
- ```
- CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DESCRIBE(name: 'VAN to PLAN Mode Transition', callback: () => {
-   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should preserve task context during transition', callback: ASYNC () => {
-     // Setup VAN mode with tasks
-     DECLARE vanMode = NEW VANMode()
-     AWAIT CALL vanMode.initialize()
-     AWAIT CALL vanMode.addTask(task: {
-       id: 'TEST-TASK-001',
-       priority: 'HIGH',
-       status: 'PLANNED'
-     })
- 
-     // Transition to PLAN mode
-     DECLARE planMode = AWAIT CALL vanMode.transitionTo(mode: 'PLAN')
- 
-     // Verify task preservation
-     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_CONTAINS(collection: CALL planMode.getTasks(), item: 'TEST-TASK-001')
-     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: CALL planMode.getTaskStatus(id: 'TEST-TASK-001'), expected: 'PLANNED')
-   })
- 
-   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should create migration document for incomplete work', callback: ASYNC () => {
-     // Setup incomplete work scenario
-     DECLARE vanMode = NEW VANMode()
-     AWAIT CALL vanMode.addTask(task: {
-       id: 'INCOMPLETE-TASK',
-       status: 'IN_PROGRESS',
-       completion: 75
-     })
- 
-     // Attempt transition
-     DECLARE result = AWAIT CALL vanMode.transitionTo(mode: 'PLAN')
- 
-     // Verify migration creation
-     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_FILE_EXISTS(path: 'memory-bank/migration.md')
-     DECLARE migration = AWAIT CALL FILE_SYSTEM.READ_FILE(path: 'memory-bank/migration.md', encoding: 'utf-8')
-     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_CONTAINS(text: migration, substring: 'INCOMPLETE-TASK')
-   })
- })
- ```
- 
- **PLAN ‚Üí CREATIVE Integration**
- ```
- CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DESCRIBE(name: 'PLAN to CREATIVE Mode Transition', callback: () => {
-   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should pass planning context to creative phase', callback: ASYNC () => {
-     // Setup PLAN mode with implementation plan
-     DECLARE planMode = NEW PLANMode()
-     AWAIT CALL planMode.createImplementationPlan(plan: {
-       approach: 'phased',
-       phases: ['core', 'features', 'polish'],
-       timeline: '2 weeks'
-     })
- 
-     // Transition to CREATIVE mode
-     DECLARE creativeMode = AWAIT CALL planMode.transitionTo(mode: 'CREATIVE')
- 
-     // Verify context transfer
-     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_DEFINED(value: CALL creativeMode.getPlanningContext())
-     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: CALL creativeMode.getPhases(), expected: ['core', 'features', 'polish'])
-   })
- })
- ```
- 
- ### 2. File System Integration Testing
- 
- **Configuration System**
- ```
- CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DESCRIBE(name: 'Configuration System Integration', callback: () => {
-   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should load and validate system configuration', callback: ASYNC () => {
-     // Test configuration loading
-     DECLARE config = AWAIT CALL ConfigManager.load()
- 
-     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_MATCH_REGEX(value: config.interaction.mode, pattern: /^(AUTO|MANUAL)$/)
-     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: config.date_management.source, expected: 'system')
-     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_DEFINED(value: config.modes)
-   })
- 
-   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should handle configuration updates', callback: ASYNC () => {
-     // Update interaction mode
-     AWAIT CALL ConfigManager.updateInteractionMode(mode: 'AUTO')
- 
-     // Verify persistence
-     DECLARE config = AWAIT CALL ConfigManager.load()
-     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: config.interaction.mode, expected: 'AUTO')
- 
-     // Verify file system update
-     DECLARE modeFile = AWAIT CALL FILE_SYSTEM.READ_FILE(path: 'memory-bank/system/interaction-mode.txt', encoding: 'utf-8')
-     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: CALL PSEUDOCODE:TRIM_STRING(text: modeFile), expected: 'AUTO')
-   })
- })
- ```
- 
  ---
  description: "Integration testing methodology for Memory Bank development"

```diff
  
  **Task Management System**
- ```typescript
- describe('Task Management Integration', () => {
-   test('should maintain task consistency across operations', async () => {
+ ```
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DESCRIBE(name: 'Task Management Integration', callback: () => {
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should maintain task consistency across operations', callback: ASYNC () => {
      // Create task
-     const taskManager = new TaskManager();
-     await taskManager.addTask({
+     DECLARE taskManager = NEW TaskManager()
+     AWAIT CALL taskManager.addTask(task: {
        id: 'INTEGRATION-TEST',
        name: 'Test task integration',
        priority: 'MEDIUM'
-     });
+     })
  
      // Update task
-     await taskManager.updateTaskStatus('INTEGRATION-TEST', 'IN_PROGRESS');
+     AWAIT CALL taskManager.updateTaskStatus(id: 'INTEGRATION-TEST', status: 'IN_PROGRESS')
  
      // Verify persistence
-     const tasks = await taskManager.loadTasks();
-     const task = tasks.find(t => t.id === 'INTEGRATION-TEST');
-     expect(task.status).toBe('IN_PROGRESS');
-   });
- });
+     DECLARE tasks = AWAIT CALL taskManager.loadTasks()
+     DECLARE task = CALL PSEUDOCODE:FIND_ITEM_IN_COLLECTION(collection: tasks, property: 'id', value: 'INTEGRATION-TEST')
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: task.status, expected: 'IN_PROGRESS')
+   })
+ })
  ```

  **Migration Creation and Processing**
- ```typescript
- describe('Migration System Integration', () => {
-   test('should create and process migration documents', async () => {
+ ```
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DESCRIBE(name: 'Migration System Integration', callback: () => {
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should create and process migration documents', callback: ASYNC () => {
      // Setup scenario with incomplete work
-     const taskManager = new TaskManager();
-     await taskManager.addTask({
+     DECLARE taskManager = NEW TaskManager()
+     AWAIT CALL taskManager.addTask(task: {
        id: 'MIGRATION-TEST',
        status: 'IN_PROGRESS',
        completion: 60
-     });
+     })
  
      // Create migration
-     const migrationManager = new MigrationManager();
-     await migrationManager.createMigration('IMPLEMENT', 'REFLECT');
+     DECLARE migrationManager = NEW MigrationManager()
+     AWAIT CALL migrationManager.createMigration(from_mode: 'IMPLEMENT', to_mode: 'REFLECT')
  
      // Verify migration document
-     expect(fs.existsSync('memory-bank/migration.md')).toBe(true);
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_FILE_EXISTS(path: 'memory-bank/migration.md')
  
      // Process migration
-     await migrationManager.processMigration();
+     AWAIT CALL migrationManager.processMigration()
  
      // Verify task preservation
-     const tasks = await taskManager.loadTasks();
-     expect(tasks.some(t => t.id === 'MIGRATION-TEST')).toBe(true);
-   });
- });
+     DECLARE tasks = AWAIT CALL taskManager.loadTasks()
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_TRUE(condition: CALL PSEUDOCODE:COLLECTION_CONTAINS_PREDICATE(collection: tasks, predicate: (t) => t.id IS EQUAL_TO 'MIGRATION-TEST'))
+   })
+ })
  ```

- describe('Git Integration', () => {

-     const gitManager = new GitManager();
+ ```

+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should execute git commands safely', callback: ASYNC () => {
+     DECLARE gitManager = NEW GitManager()
  
      // Test status check
-     const status = await gitManager.getStatus();
-     expect(status).toBeDefined();
+     DECLARE status = AWAIT CALL gitManager.getStatus()
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_DEFINED(value: status)
  
      // Test commit creation
-     await gitManager.commit('Test integration commit');
+     AWAIT CALL gitManager.commit(message: 'Test integration commit')
  
      // Verify commit exists
-     const log = await gitManager.getLog(1);
-     expect(log[0].message).toBe('Test integration commit');
-   });
- });
+     DECLARE log = AWAIT CALL gitManager.getLog(count: 1)
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: log[0].message, expected: 'Test integration commit')
+   })
+ })
  ```

```diff
  
  **File Operations**
- ```typescript
- describe('File Operations Integration', () => {
-   test('should handle file operations safely', async () => {
-     const fileManager = new FileManager();
+ ```
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DESCRIBE(name: 'File Operations Integration', callback: () => {
+   CALL PSEUDOCODE:TEST_SUITE_DEFINE_TEST(name: 'should handle file operations safely', callback: ASYNC () => {
+     DECLARE fileManager = NEW FileManager()
  
      // Test file creation
-     await fileManager.createFile('test-integration.md', 'Test content');
-     expect(fs.existsSync('test-integration.md')).toBe(true);
+     AWAIT CALL fileManager.createFile(path: 'test-integration.md', content: 'Test content')
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_FILE_EXISTS(path: 'test-integration.md')
  
      // Test file reading
-     const content = await fileManager.readFile('test-integration.md');
-     expect(content).toBe('Test content');
+     DECLARE content = AWAIT CALL fileManager.readFile(path: 'test-integration.md')
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_EQUAL(value: content, expected: 'Test content')
  
      // Test file deletion
-     await fileManager.deleteFile('test-integration.md');
-     expect(fs.existsSync('test-integration.md')).toBe(false);
-   });
- });
+     AWAIT CALL fileManager.deleteFile(path: 'test-integration.md')
+     CALL PSEUDOCODE:ASSERT_FILE_DOES_NOT_EXIST(path: 'test-integration.md')
+   })
+ })
  ```

```diff
  
  **Daily Integration Tests**
- ```bash
- #!/bin/bash
- # daily-integration-tests.sh
+ ```
+ // daily-integration-tests.sh
  
- echo "Running daily integration tests..."
- 
- # Mode transition tests
- bun test tests/integration/mode-transitions.test.ts
- 
- # File system integration tests
- bun test tests/integration/file-system.test.ts
- 
- # Configuration system tests
- bun test tests/integration/config-system.test.ts
- 
- # Migration system tests
- bun test tests/integration/migration-system.test.ts
- 
- # Generate report
- bun test --reporter=html --output-dir=reports/integration
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:DISPLAY_MESSAGE(message: "Running daily integration tests...")
+ 
+ // Mode transition tests
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:RUN_TESTS(framework: "bun", path: "tests/integration/mode-transitions.test.ts")
+ 
+ // File system integration tests
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:RUN_TESTS(framework: "bun", path: "tests/integration/file-system.test.ts")
+ 
+ // Configuration system tests
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:RUN_TESTS(framework: "bun", path: "tests/integration/config-system.test.ts")
+ 
+ // Migration system tests
+ CALL PSEUDOCODE:RUN_TESTS(framework: "bun", path: "tests/integration/migration-system.test.ts")
  ```
  
```

- **Example 4: API Endpoint Enhancement**

- scenario: "Add pagination to user list API"
